data.text: We offer many digital services for our Finnair Plus members and develop new online features constantly. You can, for example, take care of your bookings, update your personal information, or use your Finnair Plus points online. https://t.co/2Gd5VUdZfT

urls.title: Use our handy and quick online services for Finnair Plus members
urls.description: Finnair offers many digital services for our Plus members, and we are even developing new online features constantly. You can for example take care of your bookings, update your personal information, or use your Finnair Plus points online. As a Finnair Plus member you have the option to handle most of your travel and membership needs online. Our fast-developing digital services mean that you need to contact our customer servic e less and less. - The most important benefit for our customers is speed. Our

data.text: During the upcoming winter season, you can experience our renewed cabins on our New York, Phuket, Singapore and Tokyo routes. You might discover our elevated long-haul experience also on some other routes, and on all our Bangkok flights from 25 November. https://t.co/cRERPi2rZC https://t.co/SQkwwyhIAJ

urls.title: Changes in our traffic plan for winter 2022-2023
urls.description: Finnair has updated its traffic plan for winter 2022-2023. See the instructions here if your travel plans are affected due to changes. Finnair has adjusted its traffic plan for winter 2022–2023, as our operating environment has changed drastically during this year with the war in Ukraine and the subsequent closure of Russian airspace. Our aim is to operate a traffic plan that is as economically viable as possible. The traffic plan update includes flight cancellations and schedule changes. We are sorry

urls.title: Tips for travelling during the summer season and peak hours
urls.description: We collected tips for you for smooth travelling during the busy summer season. During the peak hours and busier times, the number of customers at the airports and on our flights increases. Busy times are expected from time to time, and various service points as well as security checks may be congested. Also, this summer quickly increased travel and global labour shortages of airport operators and ground service providers, are causing congestion at many European airports. Below you’ll find some tips on

urls.title: Our top 10 reasons to visit Finland
urls.description: Welcome to Finland, the happiest country in the world! Pure nature, wonderful natural phenomena, cleanest air in the world – Finland has it all. Be sure to include a Finnish sauna, delicious local cuisine and a visit to Santa Claus Village on your bucket list. As Finland has four beautiful, distinct seasons, each with unique things to experience, you might want to plan more than one trip to Finland. There are at least hundreds of reasons to travel to Finland. We introduce 10 of them. Finland has four

📷: Heikki Kotiranta, Lead Engineer at Finnair Technical Services https://t.co/e2SEKTCOQc

urls.title: 3 ways for more flexible travels
urls.description: It is finally easier to hold on to your travel plans as the pandemic has moved to a new phase. However, many of us like having flexibility with travel plans. Valtteri Helve, Head of Finnair product offering, shares his tips for added flexibility when travelling with Finnair. The first step to ensure flexibility for travel plan changes is to choose a ticket type for your needs. “Our Flex ticket is the most flexible one as it is fully refundable in case you need to cancel your trip – and it also allows

urls.title: Pack light – save fuel and make things easy on yourself!
urls.description: Packing light or travelling with only a cabin bag has many benefits, from easier travel to less climate emissions! With our clever tips, you can feel like a true packing pro. When thinking of sustainable travel, packing might not be the first thing you think about. But it is worth giving some thought. In 2018 we calculated that if every passenger that year had travelled with one kilogram less, the savings on fuel would have covered twenty flights between Helsinki and Tokyo. When you pack five kilos less,

data.text: Nihao! We are excited to return to Guangzhou, China with one weekly flight starting from 6 September 2022. We will fly from Helsinki to Guangzhou on Tuesdays and from Guangzhou to Helsinki on Thursdays: https://t.co/LjTtvW3PG9 https://t.co/BtNZrQego4

What happens if lightning strikes an aircraft? For an airline the size of Finnair, lightning typically strikes planes dozens of times a year. However, a lightning strike is not dangerous, as aircraft are designed to withstand lightning strikes. https://t.co/LA9dvtimzY

urls.title: What happens if lightning strikes an aircraft?
urls.description: Summer is the season for thunderstorms, and sometimes lightning can strike an aircraft that is flying. However, a lightning strike on an aircraft is not dangerous, as aircraft are designed to withstand lightning strikes. For an airline the size of Finnair, lightning typically strikes planes dozens of times a year. Pilots try to avoid thunderstorm clouds and fronts. Individual thunderstorm clouds can normally be avoided, but sometimes pilots have to fly throug h a thunderstorm, which also increases the

data.text: Until 28 October, you can fly to Seattle with us directly from Helsinki 3 times a week. When you wish to get off the beaten path after checking out the usual tourist attractions, take a look at these best-kept secrets recommended by a Seattle local: https://t.co/61elRpre05

urls.title: Don’t miss these three hidden gems in Seattle
urls.description: Planning a trip to Seattle and want to get off the beaten path? A Seattle local reveals the city’s best-kept secrets. Liz Johnson works at Visit Seattle and knows the Emerald City inside out. We asked Liz what her favourite less known spots are in Seattle. These are her suggestions. The largest commuter ferry network in the United State, the green-and-white ferries connect Seattle to a variety of island communities around Puget Sound. Hop on board to explore beaches, local food and drink, stunning vistas

data.text: From 1 August onwards, pets can again travel in the aircraft hold on Finnair’s long-haul flights to/from the USA. Please make the booking for your pet at least 3 weeks before your flight. Read our instructions carefully: https://t.co/YGwvljkmUR https://t.co/enkVndYMDI

urls.title: Kuusamo – an active holiday destination in the north with all the sweet treats
urls.description: Kuusamo is a true nature lover’s and active holidaymaker’s fairytale. Kuusamo’s charming nature is rich in species and delights the traveller with its almost untouched lakes, rapids and forests. The fells, hills and gorges surrounding the forest offer unforgettable experiences to all those who appreciate nature. Whether you're hoping for various astonishing adventures from your holiday or a more peaceful way to recharge your batteries in the heart of nature, Kuusamo is your destination. Nightless nights,

data.text: From a revolutionary new Business Class seat to a sensational menu that puts the very best of Nordic cuisine at its heart, our renewed long-haul cabin is a labour of love and the result of years of collaborative work by teams from across the business. https://t.co/7f9xkpYeQR

urls.title: Five changes you'll notice in Finnair's all new long haul cabin
urls.description: Finnair’s new look long haul cabin has been redesigned to make your in-flight experience better than ever. From a revolutionary new seat in Business Class to a sensational menu that puts the very best of Nordic cuisine at its heart, the renewed space is a labor of love and the result of years of collaborative work by teams from across the business. Here are five key changes you’ll notice next time you board a Finnair long haul flight. Utilizing a cutting edge 3D contoured shell, the new Air Lounge seat

data.text: You can experience our renewed cabins – our beautiful Business Class, all-new Premium Economy Class and refreshed Economy Class – on our Chicago, Dallas, Hong Kong, New York and Singapore routes. Discover more: https://t.co/azubqOuzLr https://t.co/lX9rnGSpwY

urls.title: You can reduce your flight's carbon footprint by offsetting emissions
urls.description: March this year Finnair launched a carbon offset service, where you can calculate and compensate for your flight's emissions. When you use the service, you join our journey towards carbon neutrality. Finnair's offset service lets you calculate and compensate for your flight's CO2 emissions. The service gives you options to on how much you would like to compensate by purchasing Sustainable Aviation Fuel and how much by supporting climate projects, that reduce, remove, or help avoid the production of

urls.title: Flying with kids: 5 ways to tackle feeling hangry
urls.description: Travelling with a full stomach is much more fun than the anger caused by hunger. It’s a good idea to keep your kids’ energy levels stable during the journey. Eating is also a good way to pass the time and create fun travel memories that last. Elina Wahlman from Finnair’s Customer Experience and Products team tells how she keeps her children’s tummies full when travelling. “I always play it safe with food when travelling with my children. In practice, this means that I take the opportunity to book their

data.text: Heathrow Airport requires Finnair, among other airlines, to reduce the number of customers departing from LHR Airport. We are, unfortunately, forced to cancel some of our customers' bookings. New bookings cannot be made until 11 September 2022. Read more: https://t.co/mM3ckFlWKX https://t.co/lRSGcXrPhu

urls.title: Effects of London Heathrow Airport restrictions on our flights
urls.description: Due to capacity restrictions set by London Heathrow Airport, Finnair is unfortunately forced to reduce seats on its London-Helsinki flights on 15-24 July. Finnair, among other airlines, under the threat of legal action from London Heathrow Airport, is required to limit the number of customers departing from Heathrow Airport due to heavy congestion at peak times. Finnair is unfortunately forced to reduce flight capacity on 15-24 July and cancel some of our customers’ bookings on London-Helsinki flights on

urls.title: Finnair Q2 2022 results and Q&A
urls.description: Finnair's Q2 was overshadowed by an uncertain operating environment and historically expensive fuel; however, demand began to normalise in several markets. Erkka Salonen, Director, Investor Relations We published our Half-year report yesterday. Despite the release in mid-July, our press conference and analyst call gathered quite a few participants, so our warm thanks to all those who participated. Q2 was characterised by the same themes as Q1, but they were more pronounced. Overall demand for air travel

data.text: We recommend you do the check-in in advance, pack your most essential things in your carry-on baggage and arrive early at the airport. Save yourself some time and follow our tips on how to get through the airport with less stress: https://t.co/3kluGPzLlZ

urls.title: How to get through the airport faster
urls.description: Save yourself some time and follow our tips to get through the airport with less stress. We recommend thinking ahead, starting from advance check-in that saves a lot of time and effort. The easiest way to check-in is with the Finnair mobile app. When you use the app, not only can you store your boarding pass, but you get real-time updates and other services such as the option to upgrade to Business Class or to purchase your seat assignment. Of course, sitting in the front of the aircraft always gives you

data.text: City of Angels is full of opportunities to make the most of your next trip. urls.title: How to keep the kids happy on a flight?
urls.description: Travelling with children might not be the easiest. The long waits and sitting in one place can take its toll. With a bit of preparation and our useful tips you can make things a bit more fun for the whole family. With smaller kids the key to smooth travel is having lots of options. Whether its toys, games, or snacks keep the children happy by switching things around often enough. Distraction is everything to make the time fly by. Make sure you book a window seat if you have the option to choose. That

urls.title: Seattle is an ideal spot to start your road trip from
urls.description: Finnair's new direct route to Seattle opened a world of adventures. Choose your own perfect road trip and head south towards California or north to Canada. The route from Seattle to Los Angeles - or even all the way to San Diago - spans over three states and 2000 kilometres. In theory you could drive the length in two days, but about 10 days is the minimum if you really want to enjoy the trip. There is easily enough to see for several weeks – in case you are going for a real once in a lifetime experience.

data.text: This summer, pent-up travel demand and global labour shortages are causing congestion at many European airports. Read our tips on how to make your trip smoother during the busy travel season. https://t.co/uvTp25Dc8L

urls.title: How to prepare for congestion at airports
urls.description: This summer, pent-up travel demand and global labour shortages are causing congestion at many European airports. At some airports, there have been queues of up to several hours, for example at the security check. Preparation in advance and patience are your best travel companions when you are going on a flight. A smooth travel experience is the sum of many factors. In addition to airline services, your travel path is influenced by many other air traffic operators, such as airports and ground service

urls.title: Five reasons to choose Bologna
urls.description: For many Bologna is still a bit of a hidden gem among the more popular Italian cities. Here are our top five reasons why you should go and discover its delights for yourself. Bologna is one of the biggest foodie cities in Europe and for anyone interested in Italian cuisine a mind-blowing experience. To get a good first impression of the culinary delights you might want to join in on a food tour. The options are endless, from aperitivo tours to pasta demonstrations, food market visits to wine tasting

data.text: An important tip for a busy travel season: remember to add a name tag to every piece of baggage. Airports around Europe are very congested right now, and baggage may unfortunately be delayed because of this. If your baggage has a name tag, it’s easier for us to locate it. https://t.co/B6nXR1u1GK

The multi-city booking option is back! You can now make more complex bookings with us, and return from a different destination than where you flew to – or return to a different destination than where started your journey from. Read more: https://t.co/FTww9Y220B https://t.co/dr3CVe4m5G

urls.title: What is a multi-city booking?
urls.description: By selecting “Multi-city” as the trip type, you can book a round trip for different routes in each direction. For example, you can fly from Helsinki to Rome and return from Paris to Helsinki, the travel between Rome and Paris being arranged on your own by other means. You must return from the same continent you flew to and to the same continent you left from. For example, you can fly from E urope to Asia and back from Asia to Europe but not from Europe to Asia and then from Asia to North America. When

urls.description: If you’re like most people, travelling for a holiday might be the highlight of the year for you. We’ve gathered five tips for you to enjoy your vacation to the fullest. With our travel extras you elevate your travel experience and make your journey to look like you. The easiest way to tailor your journey is with Finnair mobile app. In our Business Class you elevate your journey to the next level with maximum comfort, space and privacy, delicious meals with matching beverages and top-class service. The

urls.title: Smooth travelling at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Flying via Helsinki means that you can enjoy the compact and uncrowded Helsinki Airport, where all the gates and services are located under one roof, in one terminal building. Helsinki Airport welcomes you with its new spacious arrival and departure halls! As the main transit area for Finnair customers, the brand-new terminal will make connections extra quick and smooth. Catching a train, bus or taxi to or from the airport is now easier than ever as everything is nearby the terminal entrance. The

urls.title: Spend your summer holiday in Finland under the magical Midnight Sun
urls.description: Finland is a place where you can truly put your relaxation mode on. Finns are passionate about summer. The summer in Finland is short but the Finns really know how to make it as sweet as possible. It is impossible to say really, what is the best thing about the Finnish summer. Summer in Finland offers so many sweet treats and stunning surprises. White nights at a cosy Finnish summer house right by the water, relaxing baths at the sauna, skinny dipping in the clear lakes, magical moments in nature glowing

urls.title: Sights, scents, and flavours in Singapore
urls.description: Singapore really has it all: some of the best shopping in the world, more food options than you can imagine, entertainment to keep you busy for years and lots of green space for relaxing. Open your senses and take it all in! Singapore's famous Hawker Centres, cooked food markets, are the place to go if you want to sample a variety of great quality local dishes - for a modest price tag. The most popular is Lau Pa Sat seating over 2000 people. The offering includes traditional dishes such as Hor Fun (a

urls.title: Use Chicago as your base to explore more!
urls.description: Chicago has tons of great sights and destinations within a couple of hours of the city. Make your next trip a bit longer and see more than the Windy City. To create a perfect Chicago getaway, Finnair's direct flights let you enjoy the new elevated long-haul experience. Chicago is situated on one of the five Great Lakes, Lake Michigan. It is the only one of the lakes that is entirely on the US side of the border. If you want to see all of it, you could drive around it in a couple of days (or 15 hours

urls.title: 3 ways for more flexible travels
urls.description: It is finally easier to hold on to your travel plans as the pandemic has moved to a new phase. However, many of us like having flexibility with travel plans. Valtteri Helve, Head of Finnair product offering, shares his tips for added flexibility when travelling with Finnair. The first step to ensure flexibility for travel plan changes is to choose a ticket type for your needs. “Our Flex ticket is the most flexible one as it is fully refundable in case you need to cancel your trip – and it also allows

data.text: In May, Finnair carried 778,300 passengers, which was 840.3% more than in May 2021. The number of passengers in May 2022 was 14.4% more than in April 2022. Read more: https://t.co/NwoFofcmnj https://t.co/M9wM6EuMLX

Did you know that by reducing the weight of your baggage by 5 kilograms, you reduce your carbon footprint by about 5 per cent? When it comes to packing light and tight, flight attendants know the best. Our cabin crew member shares her useful packing tips: https://t.co/oUwU2uaaEM

We support Ukrainians with a 95% discount on net fares for one-way tickets from Warsaw, Krakow, Gdansk, Budapest and Prague to Helsinki. The discount is available with code Ukraine95 at https://t.co/906IMFcH8u until 30 June: https://t.co/s564M7g8E9. Taxes and fees will be added. https://t.co/ht3FIkRYQo

data.text: We offer 3 different ticket types – Light, Classic and Flex – in all our travel classes so that you can choose the option that best suits your needs. If you want to make your travel plans more flexibly, we recommend you choose our Classic or Flex ticket. https://t.co/jjMJSjKZqi

data.text: Heading off to your summer holiday soon? Please do the check-in in advance and arrive early at the airport. Remember to check the current travel requirements and whether using a facemask is still mandatory on your flight. See all our tips: https://t.co/FQGzO4jFnu https://t.co/K04DBnIA7p

urls.title: Tips for travelling during the summer season and peak hours
urls.description: We collected tips for you for smooth travelling during the busy summer season. During the peak hours and busier times, the number of customers at the airports and on our flights increases. Busy times are expected from time to time, and various service points as well as security checks may be congested. Also, this summer quickly increased travel and global labour shortages of airport operators and ground service providers, are causing congestion at many European airports. Below you’ll find some tips on

data.text: Our inaugural flight to Seattle was celebrated with a ribbon-cutting ceremony at @HelsinkiAirport. With this new direct flight, we are excited to be able to offer excellent transfer connections to the West Coast and Canada through our @traveloneworld partner @AlaskaAir. https://t.co/9sE4SaJTq7

data.text: Today, we are off to Seattle after 33 years! In Seattle, you’ll find beautiful nature, great restaurants, world-famous architecture and lots of museums. However, if you wish to get off the beaten path, check out these best-kept secrets by a Seattle local: https://t.co/61elRpre05

urls.title: Don’t miss these three hidden gems in Seattle
urls.description: Planning a trip to Seattle and want to get off the beaten path? A Seattle local reveals the city’s best-kept secrets. Liz Johnson works at Visit Seattle and knows the Emerald City inside out. We asked Liz what her favourite less known spots are in Seattle. These are her suggestions. The largest commuter ferry network in the United State, the green-and-white ferries connect Seattle to a variety of island communities around Puget Sound. Hop on board to explore beaches, local food and drink, stunning vistas

data.text: Welcoming Chicago to our elevated-long haul family! urls.title: Harri Koskinen: The Finnish designer on bringing his Iittala vision to Finnair
urls.description: As Finland’s foremost living designer, Harri Koskinen knows all about the beauty, form and functionality needed to create the very best in Nordic design. His Block lamp has been part of MoMA’s permanent collection since 2000, while his Muu chair won him the prestigious Compasso d’Oro Award in 2004. Koskinen has also worked with iconic Finnish table and glassware brand Iittala throughout his career, from a scholarship in their glass factory after university in 1996, through to a period as its design
